meanings.sent1: The playground was filled with mewlers who were upset about losing their game.
meanings.sent2: The daycare was full of mewlers who missed their parents.
meanings.sent3: The mewlers in the movie theater made everyone giggle with their loud complaints.
meanings.sent4: The group of mewlers at the party sounded like a choir of unhappy kittens.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was disrupted by the mewlers who couldn't find their favorite crayon.

meanings.definition: To cry weakly or querulously; whine.
meanings.sent1: The tired toddler began to mewl when her toy fell out of reach.
meanings.sent2: The puppy started to mewl when it was left alone in the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat continued to mewl until its owner finally opened the door.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches mewl like a sad ghost in the night.
meanings.sent5: The old floorboards began to mewl under the weight of the heavy furniture.
